message.content:
cs.IT, cs.GT, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.NA 

The paper deals with the design and analysis of interleavers for turbo codes, which are commonly used in communication systems. The paper focuses on algebraic constructions and properties of interleavers, which suggests that it belongs to the Information Theory (cs.IT) sub-category. Additionally, the paper discusses the spread factor of interleavers, which is a measure of their performance, and proposes a new interleaver metric that takes into account both the spread factor and a new nonlinearity metric. This suggests that the paper may also belong to the Graph Theory (cs.GT) and Signal Processing (cs.SI) sub-categories. The paper also presents an infinite sequence of quadratic permutation polynomials, which are used to generate maximum-spread interleavers, indicating that it may belong to the Discrete Mathematics (cs.DS) sub-category. Finally, the paper includes extensive computer simulations to demonstrate the efficacy of the proposed interleaver metric, which suggests that it may also belong to the Numerical Analysis (cs.NA) sub-category.
